## The university balance sheet and cash flows are strong!

 


| 
|------------------------------------|--------:|--------:|--------:|--------:|--------:|
|                                    | 2018    | 2019    | 2020    | 2021    | 2022    |
|Leverage                            | 76%     | 77%     | 79%     | 82%     | 81%     |
|Cash flows                          | 71,338  | 81,362  | 59,915  | 74,763  | 43,994  |
|

## However, finanical management started slipping after 2021
| 
|-----------------------------------|--------:|--------:|--------:|--------:|--------:|
|                                   | 2018    | 2019    | 2020    | 2021    | 2022    |
$\Delta$ revenue                    |         | 3.3%    | \-3.2%  | 5.7%    |  <span style="color:red;">\-4.7%</span> |
$\Delta$ people                     |         | 7.5%    | 1.5%    | \-0.7%  | <span style="color:red;">5.8%</span>    |
ROE                                 | 1.96%   | 0.66%   | \-1.10% | 2.30%   | <span style="color:red;">\-1.50%</span> |
Capex                               | \-43,309| \-60,284| \-46,693| \-63,479| <span style="color:red;">\-76,350</span>|
Depreciation                        | 49,448  | 51,663  | 56,848  | 46,847  | 48,363 |
Free CF                             | 28,029  | 21,078  | 13,222  | 11,284  | <span style="color:red;">\-32,356</span>|

Again, solid cash, cash flows, capital.

## What can the university do?

Focus on main cost categories:

- Staff - redundancies.
- Real estate - mainly depreciate less.


## Contributing to perils:

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}
Exogenous

- Declining EFTs
- Cost of living
- Strong job market

Endogenous

- Risk management
- 'University for old people' stigma
- TEC's FMF
- Ad interim VC

:::

The complexity of the framework led TEC to abandon it: now "holistic approach". Still, universities abide by it.


## Suggestion: manage universities like banks.

 

:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="60%"}
- Strong centralised supervision.
- Focus on governance, specifically 
  - solvency and liquidity, 
  - risk management, 
  - disclosures.
- Leave activities to the faculties.

:::
